section.title: Definition
section.para: Creates ISO images of the solution for installation via CD or DVD.

listitem.para: Specify the size per ISO, in bytes, of a set of ISO images to create. TEXT may include a SI-style suffix ("MB", "GB", etc.). The reserved values "CD" and "DVD" correspond to "640MB" and "4.7GB", respectively.
This element must occur one or more times. Each instance will result in the generation of another set of ISO images.

note.para: iso/set values are case- and space-insensitive, and the trailing 'b' is optional. For instance, the following TEXT values are all equivalent: "640000000", "640M", "640 mb", "CD".
By default, sizes are computed using 1000 bytes per megabyte. In order to use 1024 bytes per megabyte, insert a 'i' after the order designator; for example, "640 MIB" or "4.7GiB".

section.title: Examples
section.para: In the following example, CentOS Studio will create four sets of ISO images; one with 4.7 gigabytes per disc ("DVD"), one with 400 megabytes per disc ("400000000"), one with 640 megabytes per disc ("640 mb"), and one with 640 mebibytes per disc ("640 mib"). Each set will be configured with keymap and lang boot arguments.

informalexample.programlisting: <iso> <set>DVD</set> <!-- 4700000000 bytes/disc --> <set>400000000</set> <!-- 400000000 bytes/disc --> <set>640 mb</set> <!-- 640000000 bytes/disc --> <set>640 mib</set> <!-- 671088640 bytes/disc --> </iso>
